alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 05 at 2:50PM CDT until June 05 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Cameron County in Deep South Texas... South central Willacy County in Deep South Texas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 249 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Santa Monica, or near Arroyo City, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 to 70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings exposed to the north. * Locations impacted include... Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Laureles, Brownsville, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Library Memorial Middle School, Lozano, Rio Hondo Elementary School, Rio Hondo High School and Santa Monica. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
